Benefits

Visa Sponsorship if necessary
Relocation Assistance
Resume Enhancement Tips
Interview Preparation

About the company:

This Berlin-based company has been changing the food-delivery industry since 2011. More than 1000 team members work here, do their best and share their experience. First-rate investors are also the part of this start-up; they have already raised $1 billion to support this idea. This company is named World’s biggest network in this industry. The platform offers lots of choices with minimum efforts: online order and payment, any food desire can be met.

Your Role:

Do you want to live in the heart of Germany? Do you have a passion to Java? Do you like working on various projects with interesting tasks? do not hesitate and apply for this Senior Backend Engineer with relocation to Berlin.  As soon as you join the multinational team of experienced engineers, you will become a key part during the whole applications’ lifecycle. You will also:

  • Warrant that the code is one of a good quality and it’s scalable.
  • Work with a very good team to reach the goal.

Your qualification:

  • Superior experience with Java;
  • Knowledge of API- and event-based communication and microservices architecture;
  • Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform experience;
  • You love and you do improve your skills, you are passionate about new stuff, love cross-functional teams and clean code.

Relocation support:

You don't just get a new full-time job, you are becoming a part of something bigger – the team of awesome techies, the community, where every single individual matters. We care about you and aim to make your IT job abroad and IT relocation as smooth as possible. That’s why visa application process support, document consulting, coverage of flight, visa sponsorship for you and your family are a vital part of our support as an IT recruiting agency in your job relocation.

Additional information:

Germany is one of the most advanced economies in the EU, that turns relocation to Berlin into a really great and unique experience. You’ll be pleasantly surprised by generous social security benefits and high quality of life, effective educational, medical and housing systems of the excellent standard. Berlin is a significant IT center that always offers a variety of IT jobs, tech conferences and educational events to participate in. Many European and global market leaders like Amazon, Ebay, Microsoft, Twitter, Uber, Visa, Zendesk established their branches or offices in Berlin so it might be a perfect place for your innovation, education, and constant growth. In addition, excellent national and international transport links give endless opportunities to travel.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Ievgeniia Levachova

jaine-dp
ievgeniia.levachova@relocateme.tech

Have a great day!

Benefits

Visa Sponsorship if necessary
Relocation Assistance
Resume Enhancement Tips
Interview Preparation

About the company:

This company is an online broker, which allows traders to manage their deals in a modern and convenient way. Since the inception about 10 years ago, it has expanded all across Europe and now operates in 18 countries. More than 400,000 investors have already joined the network, getting access to 50 exchanges in Europe, North America, Asia, and Australia. The online-only approach significantly reduces investors’ expenses, allowing them to buy stocks at wholesale prices.

Your Role:

The company is on the hunt for a seasoned Software Architect who would help lead, mentor and grow its ambitious IT team at the head office in the vibrant city of Amsterdam. (The job involves relocation to the Netherlands. Business teams and stakeholders are present both at the Amsterdam and Sofia offices, so you need to be ready for incidental trips to Bulgaria as well.) 

The IT team currently comprises around 60 professionals, but the company is looking to double its size across Amsterdam and Sofia within the next 12 months. As a Chief Architect, your responsibilities will include:

  • Making architectural and technological decisions jointly with the dev team;
  • Providing technical expertise and guidance to the team;
  • Promotion of simplicity, design pattern and framework standardization within the company;
  • Enhancement of the existing architectural structures;
  • Assisting design teams in creating new features from concept to production;
  • Close collaboration with product owners, business departments and other stakeholders;
  • Ongoing commitment to improving the quality of codebase, the flexibility of the dev ecosystem and the capacity of the team;
  • Help in deciding on good tooling for the development work and for the production support;
  • Active participation in attracting top local talent to the team.

Your qualification:

  • 10 or more years of hands-on (software) development experience, including at least 5 as an architect mentoring and coaching others;
  • Prior development experience in Java will be a big plus (most of the software is based on Java, with some C++, React.js, and Python);
  • University degree in Computer Science, Finance or a related field (or equivalent professional experience);
  • Exposure to all phases of the software development lifecycle (SDLC);
  • Experience with Agile, CI/CD, and DevOps delivery methods;
  • Excellent documentation and commentary skills, which are essential to draw, explain, and facilitate workshops;
  • Proven track record of success in working in multi-cultural teams cross-functionally and bringing together diverse team members and perspectives to find solutions;
  • Readiness to work in an open, non-hierarchical dynamic environment;
  • Strong oral and written English communication skills.

 

Any of the following will be a plus:

  • Prior experience working in the financial service/fintech;
  • Experience with Spring, Hibernate, Apache Kafka, ZooKeeper, Git, Bamboo, Jenkins, SonarQube, or FindBugs;
  • Knowledge of the most common development and DevOps tooling;
  • Familiarity with TDD for optimal automated regression testing;
  • Familiarity with the pros and cons of different industry frameworks, design patterns, and code beautifiers;
  • TOGAF or Zachman certification (or similar experience).

Relocation support:

You don't just get a new full-time job, you are becoming a part of something bigger – the team, the community, where every single individual matters. We care about you and aim to make your IT job abroad and IT relocation as smooth as possible. That’s why visa application process support, coverage of flight, and visa sponsorship for you and your family are a vital part of our support as an IT recruiting agency in your job relocation.

Additional information:

Your Chief Software Architect position with relocation to the Netherlands will take place in the incredible city of surprises, Amsterdam, which is widely acknowledged as one of the greatest small cities in the world. Every part of the city has its own unique character and charm, turning Amsterdam in the fascinating city of tolerance and diversity, where every shade, perspective, and character is appreciated. Over the past 10 years, Amsterdam was promoted as a strong region for business and IT culture: it's home to a thriving tech and ICT industry, where the IT professionals not only enjoy the great quality of life but also a wide variety of opportunities and a great environment for self-development and career growth. At the same time, Amsterdam enjoys one of the lowest costs of living of the European capitals and highly skilled migrants coming to the Netherlands to work, a major fiscal benefit is the 30% ruling tax advantage. In addition, the city is easily accessible with fantastic air, rail and road links; there is excellent high-speed rail service connecting Amsterdam to various cities, so the rest of Europe is practically at the end of the street. Amsterdam is the city of opportunity, so you have to be ready when it presents itself.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Anna Kalniei

kalniei
anna.kalniei@relocateme.tech

Have a great day!

Your Role:

  • To design, develop, maintain, test and evaluate new backend APIs and services;

  • Expert at Python 2+3;

Your Role:

If you join this highly professional and self motivated team you will have a chance to improve your skills and share your experience with junior positions and the rest of the team. You will work with our stack which is Java 8 and Node.js and from time to time be the coach of junior colleagues in order to be sure that the performed code is of good quality. There are some extra responsibilities of Senior BackEnd Software Engineer with relocation to Berlin:

  • To follow and check the lifecycle of the development till the deployment;
  • To manage and improve the current services and apps;
  • Cooperate with product managers to ensure the best result.

Your qualification:

  • At least 4 years of Java Development experience;
  • Expert knowledge and experience working with Java, Scala and Kotlin;
  • Proficiency and willing to build architectures of reactive system;
  • Proficiency at REST, HTTP and Scrum;
  • Your code is totally clean and easy;
  • You find asynchronous messaging exciting way of achieving services resilience.
  • You are able and willing to learn new techs and tools quickly;
  • You take responsibility from beginning till the end of the development process and ever after deployment;
  • You are a team player and you can teach others how to be the one.

  • Run Kubernetes clusters in different regions around the world;
  • Empower DevOps team to monitor, manage and support current applications;
  • Run lots of containers all at the same time.

  • Superior knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes;
  • Experience and great understanding how to scale high traffic apps;
  • Deep knowledge and experience working with Unix and Linux Systems;
  • Management of Amazon web services experience;
  • Great knowledge of tools for monitoring;
  • Experience and readiness to show yourself as a troubleshooter.
